bibl.title: Despatch from Robert S. Newton to the Assistant Secretary of State
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: but as they have got a treaty with the Chief at Landana they may take charge of it at some future day. I think it little else but just that they should as the natives with few exceptions talk Portuguese and any palaver whatever is obliged to be decided in that language

At Loango I visited the merchants and the Chief of the International Association who gave some information that may be useful about the disputed points on the coast. I therefore beg to enclose a sketch map. The colours Ochre show the territory occupied by the French.
